A liberal Nembutsu Icchantika was teaching a class on Honen, known resident of Avichii.

”Before the class begins, you must get on your knees and worship Amida and accept that the Pure Land is the is the best world of all time to reach Nirvana!”

At this moment, a brave, patriotic, Nichiren buddhist who had chanted the Daimoku 50000 times in one day, achieve perfect illumination, debated other schools and won all the arguments and understood the necessity of praying to the Gohonzon stood up:

”Where in the sutras is the truth of the Lotus ranked below Amida's?”

The arrogant pure lander smirked quite schismatically and smugly replied “In the writings of Honen and Bencho, you stupid warmonger”

”Wrong. There should be a verifiable passage in the scriptures. If Shakyamuni has never been demoted in the sutras, how can you say Amida is above him?”

The Nembutsu shill was visibly shaken, and dropped his chalk and copy of the Pure Land Sutras. He stormed out of the room crying those ashura crocodile tears. The same tears icchantikas (who today live in such hedonism most can not even be reborn as humans) cried when Shakyamuni exposed the Lotus Truth. There is no doubt that at this point our Nembutsu follower wished he had pulled himself up by his bootstraps and become more than Mara's thrall. He wished so much he could attain Nirvana in this world, but he had sworn to always worship Amida!

The students applauded and became Nichiren disciples that day and accepted Shakyamuni as their creator and savior. A giant eagle named “Superior Practices” flew into the room and perched atop the flag of Japan and shed a tear on the Bonsai Tree. The Lotus Sutra of the Wonderful Law was read in the original Sanskrit several times, and Prabhūtaratna himself showed up and enacted the Law of Shakyamuni across the universe.

They left clues for us to find. Innoculously hidden in works of art from the middle ages. Symbols on paintings, signs on statues. Showing us the true state of the universe.

Internal dialogue was off most of the time instead of on 24/7.

NPCs who never feel that need stay NPCs and so they don't learn this skill, so they just eat up whatever someone with authority feeds them.
This "awakening" I suspect arises due to some sort of trauma (which I went through but I won't elaborate further) which can range from minor abuse to tragedies.
Or maybe a career choice demands the development of this skill, I highly doubt someone like a politician, detective or a psychiatrist would be one.

im beginning to suspect that this type of thing honestly applies to any game built on gamebryo or the creation engine, a few anons mentioned this earlier, but there's a distinct eerie tone to Fallout 3 and New Vegas.

I have my own story along these lines, although this was (partially) modded New Vegas. I was trying out a handful of mods, mainly an alternate start mod and weapons of the new millennia. It was a blast, but I remember distinctly stumbling across an npc at that random cross monument that's a bit east of Goodsprings. His name was Eden, and he weirdly looked exactly like my character but with different clothes and hair

He was unvoiced, but talking with him there was this crawling, extensive dialogue tree where he talked about his past and who he was, my memory is sparse on the actual dialogue, but the two things that stick with me the most are that he was a survivor of Vault 193, that the experiment had something to do with religion (his dialogue was pretty vague about it too), and that he was the victim of a sexual assault. It was pretty heavy, even for New Vegas and Fallout, but I thought it was a neat little bit of writing and guessed he was added by the alternate start mod. A few months later, I dusted off new vegas again, and since I never uninstalled it or weapons of the new milennia and the alternate start mod, the game was the same. Except, I remembered Eden, and I wanted to go talk with him to refresh my memory of his character, I thought he was very interesting, but he was gone, completely. I created a new character, reloaded old saves, even the save I made just a few moments before talking with him, he wasn't in any of them, and i can't find any proof he even existed.

threads.com:
Over the past 3 years, I have effectively made my entire life revolve around sleep and meditation.
I sleep, on average, 12 hours in any given day. When I’m not sleeping, I’m meditating.
Why do I sleep so much?

Every time I sleep, I am living in a completely separate reality that I construct in my own mind.
By training my brain through thousands of hours of meditation to understand and portray the concept of consciousness into a reality that does not exist, I am able to “live” in this reality without it existing anywhere but my own mind.
To do this, I induce deep lucid states of semiconsciousness through hours of unbroken meditation where my body sleeps intermittently, but my mind is free to wander.
And wander it does.
I can be, see, or do anything that my mind could possibly fathom.

This semiconscious meditation began as a way to calm my nerves after a busy day.

It now controls my life. I have given myself the ability to conjure any reality I could possibly imagine.
I have explored the stars. I have floated through the fabric of space and time itself. I have lived through the lives of people that do not exist. I have existed as beings that do not exist.

FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html

CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Youtube Guides:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YQjAIlFZWWc&t=790s
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9Dj9gTiLHf8
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7BMnGi8yxTQ

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

Sup fellow schizos,

I have attained what I take to be critical insight into a problematic residing at the core of geometry. I want to share and extract potential implications, specifically the paranormal ones, from my findings.

To start, please imagine a square figure in space. What you have before you is an ideal square in ideal space--this is happening free from empirical conditions, and is thus fully virtual and ideal, the a priori conceptual space where geometry resides.

Now, based on geometrical concepts, the square is a figure that has, as its boundaries or extremities, lines. Lines have only length and no width, their extremities are points. My question is this: where does the square start?

last_replies.name: Anti-Geometricus
last_replies.com:
>>33534104
The fourth square containing the blue and pink shadowing, yes. The proportions are arbitrarily drawn, true, but notice that if we take pi and subtract 3 from it, then that is the proportion (hence multiplication of it by the area r^2 of the fourth virtual square) that, when added to r^2 times 3 (the areas of the other three virtual squares) ends up being exactly the area of the circle. In other words:

A=Pir^2 = r^2(3) + (pi-3)(r^2)

Here, r^2(3) is the area of the 1,2,3 virtual squares. Added to it is (pi-3)(r^2) which is the blue shaded area (roughly drawn of course) of the fourth [4] virtual square. Added together, you get pir^2 or the formula for the square.

The blue shaded region, the (pi-3)(r^2) is the last bit, corresponding to the remainder of the division of C/d applied to the fourth virtual square, necessary to complete the area formula.

Coincidentally, the pink other area of square 4 is equal to the woodsy green shaded areas, we get that through (4-pi)(r^2) which is the other roughly shaded proportional area of the fourth virtual square.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>33533717
A point is a dimensionless object. Points are also used to represents a value on a number line. It can be rational or irrational, real, natural, whatever.
When you represent a shape with lines, ie points, its shape and size are determined by those points. The size is fixed, it is what it is, but the value of that size is relative until you pick a unit metric.
Once you pick a unit, the "square starts" at the distance specified.
tldr: The square itself, not its shape, like the point, is dimensionless, and it starts or exists at the value of its boundary as determined by a unit system.

p.s. another thing you could do, if you want the square to have thickness, is to use a discrete system instead of a continuous one. Things related to metric theory.
